intro: Saurauia kallima, commonly known as the Kallima saurauia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, particularly in countries like Vietnam and Cambodia. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
